content.description:
Improbe Amor, quid non mortalia pectora cogis!

Ire iterum in lacrimas, iterum temptare precando

cogitur et supplex animos summittere* amori

ne quid inexpertum frustra moritura relinquat.

*also appears as submittere in some texts
content.question:
Who is the subject of cogitur (line 3) ?

Identify two of the actions this person is compelled to perform in lines 2-3 (Ire . . . amori), and write out and translate the Latin words or phrases that support your answer.

frqParts.text:

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
